definitions.text: either extremity of something that has length
examples: the end of the pier
she knotted the end of the thread
they rode to the end of the line
the terminals of the anterior arches of the fornix

definitions.text: the point in time at which something ends
examples: the end of the year
the ending of warranty period

definitions.text: the concluding parts of an event or occurrence
examples: the end was exciting
I had to miss the last of the movie

definitions.text: the state of affairs that a plan is intended to achieve and that (when achieved) terminates behavior intended to achieve it
examples: the ends justify the means
we have given it at the end of the section since it involves the calculus
Start at the beginning and go on until you come to the end
he came to a bad end
the so-called glorious experiment came to an inglorious end

definitions.text: the surface at either extremity of a three-dimensional object
examples: one end of the box was marked `This side up'

definitions.text: (football) the person who plays at one end of the line of scrimmage
examples: the end managed to hold onto the pass

definitions.text: a boundary marking the extremities of something
examples: the end of town

definitions.text: one of two places from which people are communicating to each other
examples: the phone rang at the other end
both ends wrote at the same time

definitions.text: the part you are expected to play
examples: he held up his end

definitions.text: the last section of a communication
examples: in conclusion I want to say...

definitions.text: a piece of cloth that is left over after the rest has been used or sold
(American football) a position on the line of scrimmage
examples: no one wanted to play end

definitions.text: have an end, in a temporal, spatial, or quantitative sense; either spatial or metaphorical
examples: the bronchioles terminate in a capillary bed
Your rights stop where you infringe upon the rights of other
My property ends by the bushes
The symphony ends in a pianissimo

definitions.text: bring to an end or halt
examples: She ended their friendship when she found out that he had once been convicted of a crime
The attack on Poland terminated the relatively peaceful period after WW I

definitions.text: be the end of; be the last or concluding part of
examples: This sad scene ended the movie
The terrible news ended our hopes that he had survived
